FuncDef:
The traffic behavior command defines a traffic behavior and displays the traffic behavior view.
The undo traffic behavior command deletes a specified traffic behavior.
By default, the system predefines a traffic behavior named be. The traffic behavior name should not be the name of the traffic behavior predefined by the system.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a traffic behavior. The traffic behavior name should not be the name of the traffic behavior predefined by the system.
The value is a string of 1 to 127 case-sensitive characters with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To perform the same traffic behavior for a certain traffic classifier in complex traffic classification, you can run this command to create a traffic behavior and configure traffic actions in the traffic behavior.
Follow-up Procedure
You need to configure the traffic action in the traffic behavior, bind the traffic behavior and traffic classifier in the traffic policy, and apply the policy to interfaces.
For traffic actions that can be configured, see Traffic Classifiers and Traffic Behaviors, for details about the configuration process and related commands, see Defining a Traffic Behavior and Configuring Actions.
Precautions
A traffic behavior can contain multiple traffic actions, and multiple traffic actions take effect at the same time.
The traffic behavior cannot be deleted after being bound to the traffic classifier in the traffic policy.
